text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
[Student]: Do you know about it And he said this in a loud voice for his grandmothers sake and then turned on the subject again as though he had been the father of two little girls who were my friends that day
[Teacher]: I remember the holidays being a time of joy and love, of giving and sharing with family and friends. My grandmother would often host big gatherings, and the house would be filled with the delicious smells of traditional dishes and the sound of laughter and music. She would always make sure that everyone felt welcome and included, and the holidays were a time for us to come together and celebrate our love and connection. As for special traditions, I think my favorite is making cookies together as a family. My grandmother
[Student]: was very fond of them both at home and she made many of these things out of them Mr Did you ever eat anything so much when you ate asked Ethels mother I have never tried before in my life
[Teacher]: I have always loved baking and cooking, but I never had the chance to try this type of cookie. My grandmother would always make a big batch of them, and we would decorate them together with frosting and sprinkles. It was such a fun and special part of our holiday celebrations.  I also have fond memories of our family's Christmas tree decorating tradition. My grandmother would always make a special ornament for each of us, and we would hang them on the tree together.
